title.text: JHU1 : An Unsupervised Approach to Person Name Disambiguation using Web Snippets

abstractContent.text: This paper presents an approach to person name disambiguation using K-means clustering on rich-feature-enhanced document vectors, augmented with additional web-extracted snippets surrounding the polyse-mous names to facilitate term bridging.
This yields a significant F-measure improvement on the shared task training data set.
The paper also illustrates the significant divergence between the properties of the training and test data in this shared task, substantially skewing results.
Our system optimized on F 0.2 rather than F 0.5 would have achieved top performance in the shared task.

introductionContent.text: Being able to automatically distinguish between John Doe, the musician, and John Doe, the actor, on the Web is a task of significant importance with applications in IR and other information management tasks.
